REST controller providing external API access for organization management operations in the OpenFrame system. Supports full CRUD operations with filtering, search, and comprehensive OpenAPI documentation.

## Key Components

### Main Controller Class
- **OrganizationController** - External REST API controller with comprehensive CRUD operations
- **Dependencies**: OrganizationService, OrganizationQueryService, OrganizationCommandService, OrganizationMapper

### HTTP Endpoints
- **GET /api/v1/organizations** - List organizations with filtering (category, employee count, contract status)
- **GET /api/v1/organizations/{id}** - Get organization by database ID
- **GET /api/v1/organizations/by-organization-id/{organizationId}** - Get by business identifier
- **POST /api/v1/organizations** - Create new organization
- **PUT /api/v1/organizations/{id}** - Update existing organization

### Request/Response DTOs
- **OrganizationsResponse** - List response with total count
- **OrganizationResponse** - Single organization response
- **CreateOrganizationRequest** - Create operation payload
- **UpdateOrganizationRequest** - Update operation payload
- **OrganizationFilterOptions** - Query filtering parameters

## Usage Example

```java
// Inject the controller in tests or use via HTTP client
@Autowired
private OrganizationController organizationController;

// Get filtered organizations
OrganizationsResponse organizations = organizationController.getOrganizations(
    "technology",  // category
    50,           // minEmployees  
    500,          // maxEmployees
    true,         // hasActiveContract
    "software",   // search term
    "user123",    // userId header
    "api456"      // apiKeyId header
);

// Create new organization
CreateOrganizationRequest request = new CreateOrganizationRequest(
    "Tech Corp", "technology", 100, "123 Tech St"
);
OrganizationResponse created = organizationController.createOrganization(
    request, "user123", "api456"
);

// Get by ID
OrganizationResponse org = organizationController.getOrganizationById(
    "org-123", "user123", "api456"
);
```
